verses.name: Psalms 73:1
verses.text: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

verses.name: Psalms 73:2
verses.text: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

verses.name: Psalms 73:3
verses.text: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

verses.name: Psalms 73:4
verses.text: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

verses.name: Psalms 73:5
verses.text: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

verses.name: Psalms 73:6
verses.text: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

verses.name: Psalms 73:7
verses.text: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

verses.name: Psalms 73:8
verses.text: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

verses.name: Psalms 73:9
verses.text: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 73:10
verses.text: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

verses.name: Psalms 73:11
verses.text: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

verses.name: Psalms 73:12
verses.text: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

verses.name: Psalms 73:13
verses.text: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

verses.name: Psalms 73:14
verses.text: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

verses.name: Psalms 73:15
verses.text: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

verses.name: Psalms 73:16
verses.text: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

verses.name: Psalms 73:17
verses.text: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

verses.name: Psalms 73:18
verses.text: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

verses.name: Psalms 73:19
verses.text: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

verses.name: Psalms 73:20
verses.text: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

verses.name: Psalms 73:21
verses.text: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

verses.name: Psalms 73:22
verses.text: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:23
verses.text: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 73:24
verses.text: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

verses.name: Psalms 73:25
verses.text: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:26
verses.text: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 73:27
verses.text: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

verses.name: Psalms 73:28
verses.text: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.
